intro: Casearia dodecandra, commonly known as the white casearia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Its fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
